Miss Manners: Why is it rude to wash your hands in the kitchen? Advice | Miss Manners: Can I dance in the aisle while my husband sits? For a normal wedding, I think it‚Äôs $200, but that is a bit out of our league, and the whole thing was very hodgepodge. My husband wants to send $25, but I don‚Äôt know if that‚Äôs an insult.  GENTLE READER: It is if you send it in cash. But the monetary equivalent, in the form of an even minimally thought-out present, will be far less obvious in its intended message. Which is, of course, that a virtual wedding was not worth a higher price of admission.  DEAR MISS MANNERS: My mother has an active social life, with multiple friendships that have lasted decades. I have been assured that I have met these ladies, but that I was ‚Äújust a baby‚Äù at the time.  I have been blessed with two children in the last two years, and these kind ladies give my mother presents for my children. My mom brings some present from them practically every other week.  Some presents become a beloved favorite toy, while others miss the mark. That‚Äôs to be expected of gifts from strangers. My mom then urges me to write thank-you notes to her friends.  These are unsolicited gifts from strangers. I have two young children and I do not have the time to sit down and write thank-you notes to people I don‚Äôt know.  I feel that these gifts are actually meant for the grandmother to give the grandchild ‚Äî not for the mother and the child, with the grandmother acting as a delivery service. Thus, I feel that if my mom wants them to receive a thank-you note, she should be the one to write it.  GENTLE READER: Has it become so commonplace to explicitly solicit presents that we have become resentful when people give them spontaneously ‚Äî and for the sheer pleasure of it?  Never mind; Miss Manners knows the answer all too well.  Yes, these inconsiderate strangers are using your children as a conduit for expressing their affection for your mother. How rude.  If you really want the presents to stop, by all means, make your mother look bad and cease writing thank-you letters. But know that since the relative success rate of these presents is fairly high (although it should not matter), you will also be punishing your children.  The good news is that if you just hold out a couple more years, your children will be old enough to write the letters themselves. Then you can have the pleasure of nagging them.  Please send your questions to Miss Manners at her website, www.missmanners.com; to her email, dearmissmanners@gmail.com; or through postal mail to Miss Manners, Andrews McMeel Syndication, 1130 Walnut St., Kansas City, MO 64106.

A Southern California bride is desperately seeking the public‚Äôs help in finding her missing wedding dress.  Rebecca Nguyen of Mission Viejo is on the hunt for her wedding dress after a family member accidentally donated it to Goodwill.  Nguyen got married in 2017 and she left her wedding dress at her parents‚Äô house to keep it safe.  Her parents later divorced, and in the process of them moving, her wedding dress was accidentally donated to Goodwill in Brea.  In a Facebook post that has been shared over 2,000 times, Nguyen shared her story and pleaded for the public‚Äôs help in finding her dress.  ‚ÄúIf you have it, please consider selling it back to me,‚Äù Nguyen wrote. ‚ÄúI will pay more than you paid for it. You can even wear it for your wedding! I don‚Äôt mind sharing the joy and beauty of the dress. Please feel free to share this so I can get as many eyes on this post as possible!‚Äù  Orange County bride seeking public‚Äôs help in finding a missing wedding dress.  When Nguyen reached out to Goodwill, an employee informed her that the dress had been transferred to a different location and they have not been able to track its exact location.  The dress was originally purchased from Casablanca Bridal in Newport Beach.  Anyone who happens to come across the gown is encouraged to contact Goodwill and they will contact Nguyen.

A beautiful wedding at Meadowbrook Ranch last Saturday when Taylor Collins and Chase Bunn were married. For years I have driven past the bronze bucking horse statue as we drove to and from our Susanville ranch when the cattle were shipped to the mountains. This was the first time to be on the ranch, and it was amazing. It is much larger than what we see from Highway 36E as we drive up the hill. We were at the far eastern end of the meadow with a creek flowing past, and Angus cattle grazing in a pasture to the south of where the wedding was held. Across the creek were beautiful bluffs rising to the north.  It was an outdoor wedding, and the sun was hot at 4 p.m. but it wasn‚Äôt raining like the previous week when we were at the Junior Livestock Auction.  Years ago I attended a wedding when the bride arrived in a horse drawn carriage, however Taylor arrived in a viper red Peterbilt 389 with brushed black strips, powered by a high-torque X15 hooked to an 18-speed, a 280 inch wheelbase, and it lowered when stopped. The truck license plate was ‚ÄòMrs Cone.‚Äô Bruce and Kellie Cone of Cone Trucking, Redding, had loaned Mike Collins the beautiful truck for the wedding. Their arrival had a rhythmic sound coming from the truck. It was awesome!  For newcomers to Tehama County, grandfather Mike Collins has a truck and has hauled livestock across the nation, as well as known for the delicious meals at many brandings and social functions. Mike and Teri also have a fence building company as does the groom.  When we arrived, the guestbook on table was near a stock trailer where gifts were placed. Then we were asked to sign a cloth square for a quilt that will be made.  The officiants of the wedding ceremony were JB Stacy and James Miller. Best man was Garret Boyd, with groomsmen Jack Simonis, Jake Cunningham, Ben Urricelqui, Kent Johnson, and Zack Cunningham.  Ring bearers in white shirt, red suspenders and Levis were Meyer Cunningham and Ayker Fitze.  Maid of Honor was Sami Stabile and Matron of Honor was Alek Fitze. Bridesmaids in burgundy gowns were Kilee Birt, Macey Bunn, Madison Waelty and Courtny Grames.  Three little girls in white dresses were the flower girls. The tiniest was Stevi Birt, daughter of Brian and Lynsie Collins Birt, with Quincy and Karsyn Cunningham, cousins of the groom.  Taylor is the daughter of Jenifer and Bryon Waelty. She has been a Chamber Ambassador and I see her at Good Morning Red Bluff each month. She works at Summit Funding.  Chase is son of Wade and Gwen Bunn, and has Bunn Fencing.  There were many children at the wedding and there was a Bounce House for them to enjoy, while we enjoyed beverages or bottled water in the shade.  When Linda Walker and I started to bring our chairs over to the shade. James Boyd rescued us and carried the chairs.  Our table was near the dance floor and bridal table, where I had an opportunity to visit with Mike‚Äôs 93-year-old aunt Joy White from Yuma, Arizona. Guests at the wedding had also come from Florida, Oklahoma, Nevada, Colorado, Idaho and multiple other states.  Mike‚Äôs kitchen crew prepared the delicious beef dinner. Taylor and Chase greeted each guest as they handed the dinner plates to usWhat a clever idea, to be able to greet everyone and we could say ‚ÄúCongratulations‚Äù to them!  It was a beautiful wedding.  Teri Collins used social media to express her thoughts and say thank you.  ‚Äú‚ÄùThe Lord saw fit to bless us in so many ways, that we would like to take the opportunity to Thank some of the most amazing people for helping bring Taylor & Chase Bunn‚Äôs day from a drawing on paper to reality‚Ä¶.to the cooking crew that kept their promise to Taylor for keeping Mike out of an apron: Tony & Linette, Casey & Clint aka Big Fella, Larry & Dolores, John & Candie, Greg & Jenny, Roy & Casey, Alex, Katlin, Amy, Nichole, Felicia & John. Last but not least, Lee Shope for everything he did the whole week before the big day. The Cline family for giving us one of the most beautiful places in Red Bluff to celebrate a dream come true. Thank you Brian Birt for doing everything you could to bring Taylor‚Äôs day full circle. Thank you to Shanna & Dusty deBraga for sharing your wonderful table tops, bridal party table & bar. Kellie & Bruce Cone for sharing such an amazing work of art, Clifford, the Red Truck. We are truly Blessed to have such amazing people in our lives. Being able to share this day with so many wonderful friends & family from Nevada, Oklahoma, Colorado, Oregon, and places that I probably don‚Äôt even know about, not to mention all those friends & family right here in California is truly a blessing. From ages, 93 to just a few months old. The weather started out a bit warm, but ended amazing. A big shout out to Scott Stabile, Merak & a buddy for picking up the chairs before they left for the night. With all that said, I hope I didn‚Äôt hurt any feelings for forgetting them. Thank you again to each & every one that shared the day with us in every single way possible.‚Äù‚Äù

It won't be too much longer before Conor McGregor gets married to long-term partner Dee Devlin and fans have long been intrigued as to what sort of wedding the Irish couple will decide to have.  McGregor is currently the richest MMA fighter in the world, which means that if anyone can throw a lavish wedding to catch the eye then it is him.  'McGregor Forever': UFC star drops trailer for highly anticipated series about his life  He is also known for ensuring all the attention is on him and his lifestyle at any given time, so that is another reason to think it could be a pretty jaw-dropping wedding.  Are Conor McGregor and Dee Devlin married?  Fiancee Dee Devlin has played a huge role in McGregor's successful fighting career and will, of course, have her own say as to what kind of wedding the pair have.  They first met back in 2008 and have now got three children together. It wasn't until 2020 that McGregor finally popped the question and they have been planning their wedding since then, although the coronavirus pandemic hasn't helped.  Conor McGregor's wedding update  Conor McGregor has now discussed the upcoming wedding, of which details have been fairly sparse.  "My wedding is going to be extravagant, that's for damn sure," he said in an interview with Extra TV.  "We are going to have the best of the best of the best, and then more to the best.  "We have got to find the location, but it's going to be Ireland, I'm going to get married in the Emerald Isle, and then figure it out, so it's a big process.  "Let's see what happens, I'm ready for it all."  The key detail there is that the pair will be getting married in Ireland rather than in the USA.  As for the exact date and guest list, this still has to be worked out, but eventually the pair will tie the knot at what will be one of the biggest wedding parties in years.

Doug Stout  Guest Columnist  On June 17, 1919, First Lieutenant Frederick Fleek Wright boarded the U.S.S. Antigone at the port of St. Nazaire, France for his return to the United States. He arrived in New York on June 28. On July 29, he received his discharge from the Army and returned to his job at the First National Bank in Newark.  On Monday evening, Jan. 24, 1921, Frederick married Mary Elizabeth Carl at the Second Presbyterian Church in Newark. ‚ÄúThe bride,‚Äù according to The Newark Advocate, ‚Äúis the only daughter of Mr. Louis F. Carl of West Church Street. She was a student at Ward Belmont school [in] Nashville, Tennessee.‚Äù  Mary‚Äôs mother, Fannie, had passed away but was from a well-known family in Newark. Fannie was born in Newark in 1866 to Eli and Jemima Hull. Eli became a major developer in Newark. She had a much older brother who was a minister, and a younger sister that the Hulls had adopted, Laura Mae. Laura married William Wehrle, the cofounder of the Wehrle Stove Company.  In 1888, Fannie married Louis Carl. Louis was employed by the Logan Gas Company and eventually became the head of that business. Mary was born in 1898, their only child.  Tragedy struck the family 10 years later when they were living at 116 West Church Street. Fannie was raking and burning leaves in the yard when her dress caught fire. She was severely burned and died of her injuries on Dec. 17, 1908, just two days before her 20th wedding anniversary. According to family historian Gill Miller, ‚ÄúLittle Mary was, of course, in the custody of her father, but was cared for by mother‚Äôs sister, ‚ÄòAunt Laura Wehrle,‚Äô who had had only one child who died immediately post-birth in 1905.‚Äù  But Mary and Frederick's wedding day in 1921 was a happy one, according to the article that covered the prestigious families in the social column of The Advocate.  The colors for the wedding were described as a ‚Äúdeftly harmonizing rainbow‚Äù with ‚Äúcolors [of] green, gold and lavender. The altar was banked with a profusion of gorgeous palms and ferns, while large garlands of southern smilax were used in every available space. Loops of the smilax caught on the pews outlining the aisles. In the bower of greenery on the altar, candlelight glowed from numerous tall silver candle sticks. The bridal gown was of white chiffon velvet, fashioned with the short skirt and [a] full-length panel train that was caught at the shoulders. The only trimming was a touch of real lace. A great shower of a bouquet of orchids, lilies of the valley, and white sweet peas completed the costume.‚Äù  The family names mentioned in the column were a veritable who‚Äôs who of Licking County at the time.  The newlyweds left for the East Coast and took a ship to Europe. According to their passport application, the couple planned to return in about six months. They listed the countries that they wanted to see as Italy, Spain, Greece and France. Turkey was also listed but appears to have been crossed out.  The trip seems to have been successful. In March of 1922, the Wrights presented a program to the ‚ÄúMonday Talks‚Äù club at the library where Frederick was to present on, ‚ÄúThe Mediterranean Trip,‚Äù while Mary provided ‚Äúmusical selections.‚Äù  The trip also produced a son, Frederick Wehrle Wright. He was born in Newark on Dec. 3, 1921. Unbeknownst to the family, ‚ÄúLittle Frederick,‚Äù as he was known, would be the next soldier in the family.  Doug Stout is the Local History Coordinator for the Licking County Library. You may contact him at 740-349-5571 or dstout@lickingcountylibrary.org. His book "Never Forgotten: The Stories of Licking County Veterans" is available for purchase at the library or online at bookbaby.com & Amazon.com

CLEVELAND, Ohio ‚Äì I received this letter from Steve (not his real name):  ‚ÄúWe have been planning my youngest daughter‚Äôs wedding for the past year. A month before the wedding ‚Äì on the plane home from her bachelorette party ‚Äì she received a text message from a woman informing her that her fianc√© has been cheating on her. Wedding canceled.  ‚ÄúMy daughter‚Äôs heart is broken in half. Our family devastated. Her friends devastated. Wedding guests informed. Thousands of dollars in wedding expenses non-refundable. There are worse things, but this is hard. We will support and love our daughter to get through it.‚Äù  As I read Steve‚Äôs email, my first thought was, ‚ÄúWas the woman who texted the report of cheating telling the truth?‚Äù  I emailed Steve for more information. He wrote:  ‚ÄúThe text was from the woman my daughter‚Äôs fianc√© cheated with. We have since found out she contacted my daughter because she was trying to ‚Äòdo the right thing.‚Äô The fiance‚Äô told her his real name, so she curiously looked looked him up on Facebook and saw he was engaged to my daughter.‚Äù  THE COST OF A WEDDING  I called Reverend John Lentz of Forest Hill Presbyterian Church in Cleveland Heights, and read him Steve‚Äôs emails.  ‚ÄúMy heart breaks for her and her father,‚Äù said Lentz. ‚ÄúThey obviously did the right thing calling it off. That can be hard, because some of these elaborate weddings are planned two years in advance. It‚Äôs a huge industry and can be very expensive.‚Äù  Canceling a wedding can lead to embarrassment and a financial loss, even if it‚Äôs for all the right reasons.  A story by cleveland.com‚Äôs Jane Morice states the average cost of a wedding nationally is $30,000. In Ohio, it‚Äôs $26,000.  Lentz insists meeting with couples for counseling before he marries them. A few times, it was clear one of the people had substance-abuse problems.  ‚ÄúI refused to do the wedding,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI pushed for the person to go into counseling.‚Äù  Some of the couples didn‚Äôt get married. A few did, and it was disaster.  IN LOVE WITH THE IDEA OF A WEDDING  ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no such thing as a perfect couple,‚Äù Lentz said. ‚ÄúBut there are obvious warning signs, and too often people ignore them. When there is physical, substance and other forms of abuse, you can‚Äôt go through with the with wedding.‚Äù  Steve‚Äôs daughter was already sharing an apartment with her supposed husband-to-be. They were splitting the rent. She convinced him to move out, and now she pays the rent. The temptation would be to get married anyway, or at least keep living together.  ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt marry someone unless you can trust them,‚Äù said Bishop Roger Gries. ‚ÄúSo many times, I‚Äôve sat through sessions with a couple where one person believes, ‚ÄòI can change him.‚Äô Or the person thinks, ‚ÄòAfter we get married, she‚Äôll change.‚Äô People do that more often than you‚Äôd think.‚Äù  If a couple is fighting with each other and their families about nearly every detail of the wedding, that‚Äôs also a piercing warning siren.  ‚ÄúThey have these destination weddings,‚Äù said Gries. ‚ÄúI was asked to do a wedding on a Florida beach. I refused. Most of the family couldn‚Äôt afford to attend. The wedding should be about a man and woman coming together, growing together, helping each other. Start praying with each other before you‚Äôre married ‚Äì and then keep praying. God needs to be in the center of it.‚Äù  Don‚Äôt be in love with all the trappings and fantasies involved in the wedding. You can spend months, even a year, planning it ‚Äì and it‚Äôs over almost faster than you say, ‚ÄúI do.‚Äù  Gries has been a priest for 60 years. He says people can‚Äôt worry about how it looks or what others will think if they realize they need to back out of the marriage.  The big point of this story: It‚Äôs not the wedding that‚Äôs life-changing, it‚Äôs the marriage.  READERS: As I was writing this column, I was stunned by the cost of a wedding. Can you tell me what you‚Äôve paid for your own or for someone in your family? How about destination weddings? I‚Äôll use some of your feedback for my next column. I need your full name to be used in the story.  Please send comments to terrypluto1234@gmail.com  - Read more of Terry Pluto‚Äôs columns.  TERRY PLUTO‚ÄôS FAITH & YOU COLUMNS  Readers have lots of ideas about tipping:  What does our tipping say about us and our faith?  ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt feel like it!‚Äù The battle with our feelings and how to win it.  Easter and feeling like ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt forgive myself!‚Äù  Think before saying: ‚ÄúGod won‚Äôt give you more than you can handle.‚Äù  The Arizona Desert, Bruce Springsteen and experiencing God  How should we show our faith at work? COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) - Aric Hutchinson wishes he could remember the crash, but he said he does remember his bride‚Äôs last words to him before the golf cart carrying them along a South Carolina beach road from their wedding reception was hit by a car driven by a woman who authorities say was drunk.  ‚ÄúThe last thing I remember her saying was she wanted the night to never end,‚Äù he said in an interview broadcast Friday by ABC‚Äôs ‚ÄúGood Morning America.‚Äù  The bride, Samantha Miller, 34, was killed in the April 28 crash and Hutchinson and two other passengers were injured. A toxicology report showed the driver of the car, Jamie Lee Komoroski, 25, had a blood alcohol level of 0.261 ‚Äî over three times the legal limit. She is charged with reckless vehicular homicide and three counts of driving under the influence causing death or great bodily injury. Komoroski is currently being held without bond at a local jail, according to Charleston County Sheriff‚Äôs Office online records.  In a statement, Komoroski‚Äôs defense attorneys, Chris Gramiccioni, Deb Gramiccioni and Nathan Williams, asked the public not to rush to judgment.  ‚ÄúOur court system is founded upon principles of justice and mercy and that is where all facts will come to light,‚Äù they said.  Hutchinson said he remembers waking up in the hospital and knowing something was wrong when he saw his mother‚Äôs face.  ‚ÄúI asked her, ‚ÄòWhere‚Äôs Sam? Where‚Äôs Sam?‚Äô and that‚Äôs when she told me there was an incident and that Sam didn‚Äôt make it,‚Äù he recalled.  Hutchinson remembers Miller‚Äôs calmness on their wedding night despite all the stresses of wedding planning. Family and friends came from all over the country and everyone, including Miller, was so happy.  ‚ÄúI‚Äôm still trying to wrap my head around it, that night, going from an all-time high to an all-time low,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs pretty rough to try to comprehend.‚Äù  Being back at the home he and Miller shared is hard, ‚Äúbut also nice,‚Äù Hutchinson said.  ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs got Sam written all over the house,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúSo it‚Äôs nice to be here and have good memories.‚Äù  Hutchinson said he doesn‚Äôt have anything to say to Komoroski at this time.  ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt right now,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôd like to. I mean, she stole an amazing human being that should not have been taken.‚Äù  In addition to the criminal case, Komoroski faces a wrongful death lawsuit alongside several businesses accused of overserving her on the night of the crash.  Four bars gave ‚Äúcopious amounts of alcohol‚Äù to a ‚Äúvisibly intoxicated‚Äù woman ‚Äî Komoroski ‚Äî last month before she drove 40 mph (64 kph) over the speed limit into a golf cart carrying the couple away from their wedding reception, according to a new lawsuit filed Wednesday by Hutchinson and his relatives.  A taqueria that had recently hired Komoroski is accused of negligence and recklessness. An unnamed Taco Boy supervisor coerced the new server into consuming ‚Äúa dangerous amount of alcohol‚Äù at an employee function before the crash, according to the complaint.  In a statement on its website, Taco Boy denied that an ‚Äúofficially organized employee function around drinking‚Äù occurred. The statement said video footage, staff interviews and sales receipts confirm that Komoroski, who has since been fired, did not enter the restaurant on the day of the accident.  Copyright 2023 The Associated Press. All rights reserved.

It's a happy ending for a woman in Buckingham County who was going through a bride's worst nightmare - a missing wedding ring. With the help of social media, she was reunited with her ring in Lynchburg on Saturday.  Casey Johnson and her family were on a Mother's Day getaway in Virginia Beach last weekend when she lost her wedding ring in the sand.  "My daughter wanted me to walk her down to the water, so I stood up, and just not thinking, brushed the sand off my hands, and right when I did, I felt my ring fly right off," said Johnson. "We sat there for hours just hands and knees raking through the sand trying to find it, eventually we just gave up," she added.  PHOTOS:    Billy Robb and Michelle Salisbury of Bedford County were helping Johnson look for her ring. They didn't have any luck when they were all looking together, but Robb and Salisbury decided to give it another go a few hours later.  "I just thought, you know, I'm gonna walk by where they was, you know, and just happened to look, and she was walking up to me [Salisbury], and I literally looked down and I seen it right away," recounted Robb.  They immediately searched for Johnson up and down the downtown area of Virginia Beach, but couldn't find her. They thought, might as well try to spread the word using TikTok.  "And I said, you know, well it's a shot in the dark but by why not, crazier things have happened," said Salisbury. "I posted it and the next day it just started going crazy," she said.  SEE ALSO:  Click here to watch .  Nearly 500,000 views later, it finally made its way to Johnson.    "My mother-in-law sent me Michelle's TikTok and it was just amazing that she found it and went to that extent to give it back to me and I'm really thankful for her," Johnson shared.  "It was such a good feeling to finally reunite with my ring. I didn't think I would ever get it back," she said.

Weddings are expensive, and not just for the bride and groom.  As more couples choose to go all out on their nuptials, the average guest will spend $611 on travel and accommodations, gifts and special-occasion attire and preparation this year, according to a recent report by Bankrate.com. Wedding gifts alone average $180.  "Like just about everything else, inflation and higher interest rates are taking a toll on wedding attendees," said Ted Rossman, Bankrate's senior industry analyst.  More from Personal Finance:  Credit card debt nears $1 trillion  How to get started with investing, budgeting  How much emergency savings you really need  At a time when many households are already stretched thin, every "yes" RSVP poses a potential financial strain.  About 21% of wedding guests feel pressured to spend more than they comfortably are able to, and 18% must lean on credit cards just to attend, Bankrate found.  According to a separate survey by LendingTree, 40% of those who attended a wedding in the past five years have taken on debt to cover the cost.  For members of the wedding party, it's even costlier: Nearly two-thirds, or 62%, have spent more than they could afford to celebrate with the bride and groom, and 32% went at least $500 in the red, LendingTree found.

Last weekend at Paul Choi and Ashley Austin Morris‚Äôs wedding in a little stone church on Roosevelt Island, there was the sort of giddiness in the air that you might expect to find at an actual island destination wedding. That‚Äôs because most of their guests, despite years of living in New York City, had never stepped foot onto Roosevelt Island, the residential waterfront Manhattan community sitting in the East River.  ‚ÄúI took the cable tram here once and then I went right back,‚Äù said David Wodka, a groomsman. ‚ÄúI never thought there was anything noteworthy on Roosevelt Island. But now that I‚Äôm here, I can see why they picked this venue. It‚Äôs beautiful, and you can see people jet skiing on the water.‚Äù  The ceremony was held at the Sanctuary, a wedding and events venue that took over this old church on the island‚Äôs north side over two years ago, rescuing it from ruin. With a leafy outdoor dining space that offers a plumb view of Manhattan‚Äôs skyline and an Instagrammable concrete pier that juts out into the East River, the Sanctuary has since become an unlikely matrimonial hot spot. Its pitch is that it is a destination wedding within city limits, reachable via a scenic tram ride from Midtown for the cost of a MetroCard swipe.

Courtney Sneddon, 26, a personal assistant based in Edinburgh, let her hair grow for two years in anticipation of her wedding in November 2022. ‚ÄúI was counting down to when I could cut it off for my honeymoon,‚Äù she said. But when Ms. Sneddon‚Äôs hairstylist, Christopher Laird, offered a mid-wedding cut instead, she thought, ‚ÄúWhy not?‚Äù Ms. Sneddon added: ‚ÄúIt was either this or another dress, and since I wanted a cut anyway, it was an easy decision.‚Äù  While guests enjoyed dessert, Ms. Sneddon sneaked away with Mr. Laird, who cut and styled her long, straight hair into a soft and wavy collarbone-length bob in just 20 minutes. ‚ÄúThe first thing she did after we cut it was head to the dance floor and headbang,‚Äù Mr. Laird recalled. ‚ÄúShe felt amazing, fierce and really liberated.‚Äù  Olivia Lopez, 26, a labor and delivery nurse in Edmond, Okla., opted to change both her outfit and her hair for her wedding last August. Ms. Lopez stole away for a few minutes during dinner, swapping her dress for a white sequin jumpsuit and her long ponytail for a wavy, shoulder-length bob.  ‚ÄúMy husband knew I was changing into a different outfit for the reception but had no idea I planned to chop my hair off, too,‚Äù said Ms. Lopez, adding that her husband, Luis Lopez, 28, who oversees alumni engagement and fundraising for Oklahoma Christian University, was stunned by her transformation. ‚ÄúI was completely caught off guard,‚Äù Mr. Lopez said. ‚ÄúOlivia looked gorgeous. It was such a memorable moment.‚Äù

Wedding speech ghostwriters share their stories - and explain why more and more people are secretly availing of their services  ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs still very much seen as a secret service,‚Äù Heidi Ellert-McDermott explains. ‚ÄúI‚Äôd say that 97 per cent of our clients don‚Äôt tell anyone.‚Äù The secret that her clients are keeping from their significant others? It‚Äôs nothing remotely salacious ‚Äì rather than googling gags and hoping for the best, they‚Äôve just hired a ghostwriter to work on their wedding speech.

Now-a-days people are preferring online wedding planners and bookings for their marriage, which is propelling the market growth for online booking of wedding services around the world.  Asia-Pacific, followed by North America, to maintain its dominance by 2030  Based on region, Asia-Pacific, followed by North America, held the highest market share in terms of revenue 2020, accounting for nearly half of the global wedding services market. Moreover, the same region is expected to witness the fastest CAGR of 5.3% during the forecast period, as wedding services markets of Asia Pacific particularly from South East Asia are identical with opulent, extortionate multiple-day celebrations, which comprise a huge crowd with big celebration. Uttarakhand: The wedding invitation card of a BJP leader‚Äôs daughter has gone viral on social media. The reason for that is that the daughter of BJP leader Yash Pal Beynam of the Pauri region of Uttarakhand is ready to marry a Muslim youth.  The marriage invitation of Beynam‚Äôs daughter has attracted attention on social media, and BJP supporters and netizens have expressed their objection.  Hindutva group has trolled former MLA Beynam. According to the report, criticism has been expressed on the internet about someone else accusing someone else of marrying a Muslim youth as love jihad.  The movie ‚ÄúThe Kerala Story‚Äù has been given tax exemption in BJP-ruled states where the daughter of a BJP leader is getting married to a Muslim youth. A Facebook user has expressed his displeasure that such dual policies by the BJP will weaken the morale of the party workers.  BJP leaders and activists of right-wing organisations had accused Muslim youths of converting Hindu women by marrying them and termed it ‚Äúlove jihad.  There is a lot of discussion about conversion in India. But the BJP leaders are throwing their daughter away to Muslim youth. It is reported that a member of the Pauri temple management board said that the Vishwa Hindu Parishad and Bajrang Dal should oppose this.  Beynam‚Äôs daughter‚Äôs wedding will be held on May 28. BJP and Congress leaders have been invited to this wedding event, reports said.

Not only are this bride and groom from opposite ends of Ireland, but they also travelled to the opposite end of the globe to meet.  Sin√©ad O'Leary, from Killarney, County Kerry, and Brian McGrenaghan, from Larahirl, Culdaff, County Donegal, happened to be living in Australia when their paths crossed in Coogee, Sydney, in January 2015.  Sin√©ad O'Leary and Brian McGrenaghan at Muckross Abbey  And it was during a summer stroll, back in the bride's home town, that they got engaged, four years later, on the shores of Lough Leane. ‚ÄúIt was a beautiful warm sunny day and we took a walk with our daughter Lyla-Rose, who was almost two at the time, and our son Jack, who was only eight weeks old,‚Äù says Sin√©ad. ‚ÄúBrian had the ring box tucked away under his jumper and when I was admiring the view he got down on one knee and asked me to marry him.‚Äù  Sin√©ad O'Leary and Brian McGrenaghan with their wedding party  That June proposal led to a November wedding, three years later, as they exchanged vows a little further along the road, in the Muckross Park Hotel & Spa, holding their reception in the same five-star venue.  Killarney National Park created the picture-perfect on their big day, which was precisely what the couple wanted, as they could pay tribute to the bride's father, the late Paudie O'Leary, in a special way.  Sin√©ad O'Leary with Donnchadh O‚ÄôLeary, Lyla-Rose McGrenaghan, Stacey MacSweeney, Sueanne Bedggood, Muireann O‚ÄôLeary and Naomi O‚ÄôConnor  Nearby Muckross Abbey was one of the most important locations to which their wedding photographer, Miche√°l O‚ÄôSullivan, (osullivanphotographyirl.com), led the bride and groom for their photoshoot. ‚ÄúMy dad was the head park ranger for many years in the Killarney National Park and is also buried in Muckross Abbey so this was a very special place for us, as we felt we had my dad‚Äôs presence with us in spirit on our wedding day,‚Äù says the bride.  Those who played a key role in the ceremony and celebrations were the bride‚Äôs mother, Geraldine O'Leary, and the groom‚Äôs parents, Margaret and Brian McGrenaghan.  Sin√©ad O'Leary and Brian McGrenaghan at Muckross Abbey  "My lovely brother, Donnchadh O'Leary, walked me down the aisle," says Sin√©ad.  The couple‚Äôs daughter, Lyla-Rose McGrenaghan, was their flowergirl; and their sons, Jack and Killian McGrenaghan, were their pageboys.  Sin√©ad‚Äôs friend, Stacey MacSweeney, was her chief bridesmaid, while her sister, Sueanne Bedggood, and Muireann O‚ÄôLeary joined forces with another friend, Naomi O‚ÄôConnor, to take on bridesmaid duties.  Sin√©ad O'Leary and Brian McGrenaghan with Margaret and Brian McGrenaghan and Geraldine O'Leary and Donnchadh O‚ÄôLeary  Brian‚Äôs friend, Christopher Gibbons, was by his side as his best man while his friend, Phil McElhinney, was groomsman along with his brother, Sean McGrenaghan, and nephew, Sean Donaghy.  The couple wanted their wedding to have ‚Äúan outdoor feel inside with seasonal flowers and fauna‚Äù. ‚ÄúWith it being a winter wedding we wanted candles to bring warmth into the reception and ceremony and deer antlers as a representation of my dad and the national park,‚Äù adds the bride.  Sin√©ad O'Leary and Brian McGrenaghan with their wedding party in Muckross Abbey  What made the occasion extra-memorable was that they could share it with family and friends, adds Sin√©ad, in particular, ‚Äúour three beautiful children‚Äù.  Sin√©ad looked elegant in Spanish bridal label Pronovias, which she sourced in Sydney and the bridal hair and makeup were by Joanne Henderson and Sandra Flynn.  Sin√©ad O'Leary with Lyla-Rose McGrenaghan Stacey MacSweeney, Sueanne Bedggood, Muireann O‚ÄôLeary and Naomi O‚ÄôConnor  The groom and his party were dapper thanks to Esquire Formal Wear, Co Derry.  ‚ÄúOur son Jack, who was three-and-a-half at the time, didn't want to wear his wedding shoes. He wanted to wear his work boots ‚Äî ‚Äòlike Daddy's workboots‚Äô!‚Äù says Sin√©ad.  Sin√©ad O'Leary and Brian McGrenaghan at Muckross Abbey  ‚ÄúI really would not have cared really once Jack was happy but he wore the wedding shoes in the end.‚Äù Brendan Reidy, videographer, was also behind the lens, while Tie the Knot Weddings created the floral arrangements.  ‚ÄúWe have yet to go on a honeymoon ‚Äî not easy with three small kids! ‚Äî but the honeymoon can wait for now!‚Äù jokes the bride. ‚ÄúWe only moved home from Australia almost a year ago and are currently based in Donegal. We will see what the future holds for us as to where we will end up living.‚Äù  Sin√©ad O'Leary and Brian McGrenaghan with their wedding party  If you would like your wedding featured in Weekend email eve.kelliher@examiner.ie

Tina Rae's coffee cart at the wedding that ended up at the Disputes Tribunal.  A bride who took her wedding caterer to the Disputes Tribunal said she received platters two hours late, was left with just one scantily-clad waitress serving 100 people and ‚Äúcountless excuses‚Äù.  The caterer, Tina Rae, feels she's been unfairly criticised online but is getting out of the wedding business for good.  Her business has 20 one-star reviews accusing her of cancelling events at the last minute, or providing sub-par platters.  Rae bought Fare Food Boutique Co, which provides catering services from a coffee cart, in October.  She was hired by the bride to provide food platters, some drinks, and bar services for her wedding on February 3 at a cost of $2000.  Supplied/Supplied Tina Rae's coffee cart at the wedding that ended up at the Disputes Tribunal.  After the wedding, bride Aleshia Scott posted a critical Google review and went to the Disputes Tribunal to seek a $1500 refund. She said Rae did not provide the services she paid for with reasonable care and skill.  The referee agreed and ordered Rae to pay before June 11. Rae said she was asking for a rehearing because repeated phone calls from the tribunal referee did not connect.  In a counterclaim, Rae sought $3500 for stress and derogatory comments she alleged caused her to lose work. The referee dismissed Rae‚Äôs claim because the tribunal did not have jurisdiction to hear it.  In her decision, the referee said she tried to call Rae‚Äôs cellphone number seven times over 35 minutes to connect her to the hearing, but Rae did not answer. The absence of one party does not prevent a hearing going ahead.  The referee said she accepted Scott‚Äôs ‚Äústraightforward and plausible‚Äù evidence.  Supplied/Supplied Scott‚Äôs bridesmaid, sister-in-law and celebrant having to work the bar.  Scott told the hearing she arranged for Rae to bring out platters for her guests at 4pm, but they didn't arrive until nearly 6pm, when the guests were about to start their main meal.  She had paid for three bar staff for six hours, but just one staff member was on site for several hours and they did not seem competent, resulting in her family feeling they needed to step in and serve drinks themselves, she said.  ‚ÄúI actually just had to try my hardest to ignore it, everyone told me not to worry but my bridesmaid, sister-in-law and celebrant had to work the bar,‚Äù Scott told Stuff.  Scott said she had put everything in writing for Rae so that the day would run as smoothly as possible and there would be no room for faults.  Glassware was not cleared away from tables as promised, and drink dispensers, barista-made coffee, tea, ice, lawn games, a dessert platter, a candy station and a generator were not provided as arranged, the referee said.  She acknowledged Rae had ‚Äúresourcing and illness issues‚Äù, but said it was her responsibility to have backup plans to deliver what she promised.  Scott‚Äôs Google review included issues with the way Rae‚Äôs staff were dressed, and Rae leaving with her daughter for two hours without telling anyone.  ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs already a stressful day to begin with and to have my grandparents come up and ask me why that girl was dressed like that, it was embarrassing,‚Äù Scott told Stuff.  ‚ÄúOne of the young girls was wearing short shorts, a crop top and a crop top/bar and were all rude to the guests, we had many complain to us about their attire and their attitudes,‚Äù she wrote in the review.  Rae told Stuff she answered the referee‚Äôs calls but couldn‚Äôt hear anything, so asked for a rehearing.  Rae said, and put in a statement to the tribunal, that the wedding did not go as planned because two staff were sick with Covid and her daughter, who was one of the backup wait staff, started to feel very unwell in the extreme heat that day and she had to take her to hospital. The person who did work was called in at the last minute and had no time to dress differently.  She alleged some of the wedding guests were drunk and rude to the worker.  Supplied Rae was to provide bar services for guests, but sickness meant she was short-staffed. (File photo)  Rae told Stuff she agreed to stay two hours later to make up for the time she spent taking her daughter to hospital and was unable to do a hen party also booked for that night.  ‚ÄúLots of different things went wrong. It‚Äôs not an excuse, it‚Äôs just what happened. It‚Äôs been an absolute palaver. I will never do any other wedding ever, not even for friends.‚Äù  While she gave the hen party a full refund, she said the guests all went online to give her one-star reviews, which, along with Scott‚Äôs Google review, prompted another upcoming bride to cancel. The contract meant she was not entitled to get her non-refundable deposit back, Rae said.  That bride, Monique Sara, told Stuff she cancelled because she lost faith in Rae‚Äôs ability to provide the service she expected. She said she booked Rae based on photographs she saw of the platters online, which were taken before Rae bought the business.  ‚ÄúIt looked incredible but by the looks of things it was an old owner,‚Äù Sara said.  UNSPLASH Rae failed to provide platters for a 70th wedding anniversary at short notice but did pay a refund. (File photo)  Amanda Rait said she paid Rae $375* for two platters for her grandparents 70th wedding anniversary in January. However, Rae cancelled three-and-a-half hours before the event, which caused stress and disappointment. She received a full refund eventually, she said.  Rae said she had to cancel that event because she was assaulted the night before by people trying to steal her carts. She had two coffee carts previously and an ice cream cart that she bought and resold. She now hoped to sell the Fare Food Boutique Co cart and buy a smaller one to continue a smaller-scale coffee business.  Rae said the bad reviews had prompted rude messages and comments all over social media ‚Äì ‚Äúso much so we have ceased all business‚Äù.  ‚ÄúSo currently there is no way of being able to pay anyone due to the online harassment and dressing down,‚Äù she said.  *A previous version of this story incorrectly said Amanda Rait paid $750 when she paid $375.

Need help getting those wedding guest ‚Äòfits lined up? We‚Äôve got you.  Many social calendars are overflowing with celebrations this summer as the wedding boom kicks into high gear and couples are back on track throwing multi-day celebrations. When it comes to wedding guest dressing in 2023, not only do you need an outfit to wear to one event, but possibly two or three. That means you‚Äôll do yourself a favour if you start your pursuit to find looks for these events, like, now.  Taking cues from the season‚Äôs top fashion trends, from tailored suits to floral dresses and cut-out designs, we‚Äôve put together 20 perfect wedding guest outfits that you‚Äôll be able to wear again and again, plus 5 essential accessories to finish off your look.  The floral dress  Colours are bold, patterns are simple or statement. This season, flower patterns are in full bloom.  The retro chintz Laura Ashley fabric and the modern drop sleeve design make this dress a dream.  The easy silhouette and light cotton fabric of this toile de jouy garden-print dress makes it a beautiful yet comfortable choice. Pair it with whimsical Mary Janes or a block-heel knotted sandal.  This slinky column gown is the epitome of elegance. Our favourite statement detail: shoulder bows with trailing tails.  If you love a bold print, this colourful, curve-hugging dress is a perfect choice. This dress is also beautifully size inclusive, available in sizes XS to 2X.  Our new obsession at Simons is its collection of pieces made with Liberty of London fabrics. This floral shirt dress is lovely for a casual garden or lakeside wedding party.  The cut-out dress  This is the way to flash a little skin in a subtle, alluring way.  This dress feels very mermaid-chic, a vibe that is definitely trending. The seafoam shade and ruffled skirt are so ethereal, and the side cutouts show just a sliver of skin.  This sweet pink midi dress with spaghetti straps and a bodice bow detail is a fashion classic and a piece you will be wearing for event seasons to come.  We love the lightweight linen fabric of this dress as well as the rich crimson colour. It‚Äôs perfect for a summer or early fall wedding‚Äîwrap up with a cozy pashmina when the nights get cooler.  From influencer Sarah Nicole Landry‚Äôs new collab with Reitmans, this two-piece top and skirt set is a super chic way to wear the cut-out trend.  This sleek sage-hued jersey dress not only looks like a knockout, but is an incredibly cost-conscious buy.  The suit  Power dressing has spilled over into wedding guest attire. We love a colourful suit that can be sleek, or a little slouchy.  This Tencel suit is super-soft and has a beautiful draped cut. Pair it with white mules for a look that‚Äôs pure quiet luxury.  Men‚Äôs suiting experts Indochino have launched a women‚Äôs line of made-to-measure pieces and this bold yellow double-breasted suit is a standout style.  This boxy suit is giving the best ‚Äô90s vibes. The poppy pink shade make this suit a star and a perfect choice for casual cool or more formal elevated events‚Äîjust switch up your accessories.  This wide-leg poplin jumpsuit is finished with the most perfect shoulder bows! It‚Äôs available in four stellar shades: lilac, marigold, denim and black and comes in a wide range of sizes.  Navy is always a crisp and cool colour choice for a wedding. This easy linen suit is a smart buy that can take you from a wedding day to a business event to date night.  The maxi dress  A longer midi or maxi style always looks elegant and can strike a more casual or formal note.  The Camden dress features a sleek strapless design with a cut-out back detail. The satin fabric drapes beautifully and it‚Äôs available in a range of solid shades and patterns like this abstract floral motif.  This knife-pleat batwing sleeve dress brings the drama. It‚Äôs also one of the brand‚Äôs signature Curve styles which means it‚Äôs available in a wide range of sizes.  Hill House Home‚Äôs iconic nap dresses have become synonymous with fresh summer style. The Ellie midi dress is a fan favourite and we love it for a destination beach wedding or brunch celebration.  This pretty pink ruffled gown is so easy to wear and the fabric has a beautiful swooshing effect when you move. It will look amazing on the dance floor as you boogie into the wee hours.  If you love a black gown but crave a little added interest, this Alessia dress from Ba&Sh is a gorgeous as it gets. The metallic pattern and open back line are simply stunning.  Essential wedding guest accessories  Five fashionable extras that pair well with every look  The Large Dome Croissant Hoops are a favourite of The Kit editors‚Äîwe love them for their versatility and bold design. These work with almost anything you can imagine.  Beloved Canadian shoe brand Poppy Barley has just introduced its first wedding collection and we are smitten. The Esther heeled sandal is a stunner and in addition to this beige tone is available in ivory and gold.  This freshwater pearl bracelet with a modern paperclip link chain is a cool piece with purpose. One hundred percent of the net proceeds from the sale of the Paris Jewellers Asian Heritage Hope Bracelet will be donated to the Canadian Asian Solidarity Fund and Stop AAPI Hate.  The croissant bag is the most coveted style of the season and A Bronze Age‚Äôs Kiki bag in satin is a perfect pick. Available in five fabulous shades: citrus, butter, lavender, black and magenta  This sleek mule is the perfect height and we love the wicker-effect finish on the heel. The shoe is part of Aldo‚Äôs new Pillow Walk collection which means it‚Äôs comfy, too! A brawl erupted at a wedding in HCMC on Thursday between friends of the bride and groom, resulting in several being injured.  Video footage of the dispute at the wedding at Dam Sen water park in District 11 showed dozens of people getting into a verbal disagreement, before one member of the group left the venue and returned with sticks and pitchforks.  As they were trying to get back into the venue, they were blocked at the door. The group then smashed down several doors and a chaotic brawl ensued.  The entire ordeal lasted about a minute, with several people receiving mild injuries.  District 11 police on Friday summoned several people related to the incident.  An initial investigation revealed that the dispute was over a business disagreement between two friend groups of the bride and groom.

The Ottawa Senators have been a fairly lean operation for some time now. With new ownership about to arrive this summer, apparently spending close to $1 billion for the franchise, it will be interesting to see if they expand staffing throughout the organization.  At the rate the players are going this off-season, the team may need to consider hiring a wedding planner.  We already know that Sens captain Brady Tkachuk is getting married this summer to his partner, Emma Farinacci.  And now, in the past month alone, at least three other members of the Ottawa Senators have bent the knee to propose to their longtime girlfriends, all taking to Instagram to announce their big news to the world. In each case, their happy hockey teammates, past and present, jammed their replies with congratulatory messages.  Sens defenceman Thomas Chabot took a knee on a beautiful beach in Anguilla this week to propose to his longtime partner, Marion Pandreau.  Sens centre Jake Lucchini, who played 11 games for the Senators this season, also proposed this week to his girlfriend, Abbie Botz, back home in Madison, Wisconsin.  Senators winger Parker Kelly got the ball rolling in April. While on vacation in Kailua-Kona, Hawaii, Kelly popped the question to his longtime girlfriend, Kiarra McMullan.  The answer, by the way, was yes on all counts.  ‚ÄúAh, spring, when a young man‚Äôs fancy lightly turns to thoughts of love.‚Äù  ‚Äì Alfred, Lord Tennyson

Brides and grooms-to-be have spoken of their fury after a four-star hotel closed suddenly and cancelled their weddings so it could house 230 migrants.  Needham House Hotel in the village of Little Wymondley, near Hitchin in Hertfordshire, shut its doors earlier this month after the Home Office booked the property out completely for a year.  Jade Kolonics and her fiance Danny Neal were due to get married at the venue on August 25 and the couple were putting the finishing touches on their preparations.  Ms Kolonics said: 'Our invites have been sent and RSVP'd to, guests have booked hotel rooms - we have family coming down from all over - and now, only 15 weeks away from the big day, we have no venue, no food and no hotel rooms.  'I am beyond stressed and it has had a massive impact on my mental health.'  Jade Kolonics and her fiance Danny Neal were due to get married at the venue on August 25 and the couple were putting the finishing touches on their preparations  Nicola Harmel was supposed to be tying the knot at the hotel next summer but now wants to find another venue  Needham House Hotel in the village of Little Wymondley, near Hitchin in Hertfordshire, shut its doors earlier this month after the Home Office booked the property out completely for a year  Nicola Harmel was supposed to be tying the knot at the hotel next summer but now wants to find another venue.  She is demanding a refund by Needham House but bosses say they can still hold the ceremony as the hotel should be free by then.  Ms Harmel fumed: 'We have our wedding booked next August and no refunds can be made because they have the government contract for one year.  'Needham House said the wedding will go ahead. However, the Novotel in Stevenage had a one-year government contract and it's now one and a half years and they still haven't opened the doors to the public.  'I cannot risk having three months to go for them to say they are extending the contract. We need the money from the deposit to put on another location.'  HAVE YOU BEEN AFFECTED BY THE CLOSURE? Email: tom.pyman@mailonline.co.uk  Meanwhile, customer Lewis Male said: 'My partner and I are due to get married in July and had over 25 rooms booked at this venue for our wedding for family and friends travelling up from Somerset.  'We are devastated and not sure what to do at all.'  Rob Close has his wedding booked at Needham House in 2024 but was given a nasty shock when he saw the state of the hotel after driving there recently to seek assurances his big day could still go ahead.  The Needham House Hotel (pictured) closed up earlier this month after the Home Office booked it out in its entirety for 230 migrants  The hotel (pictured inside), whose website is no longer in use, has cancelled 11 weddings and two proms since it was forced to shut up shop  He jumped in his car after getting no answer on the phone and said: 'I found the hotel starting to be stripped down, furniture moved out the way and being organised into different areas.  'We had a meeting at the venue on May 4 to discuss upgrades to our package, booking further rooms, and layouts, with no inclination of anything like this happening.  'I have heard deposits paid for 2024 will not be refunded as this contract is only for a year and Needham House could still honour these bookings, despite no way of telling what condition the facilities and rooms will be in.  'We are devastated as it the perfect venue for us but we are yet to have even heard from them.'  Miss Kolonics is expecting a refund of several thousand pounds for the disruption and has luckily now found a new venue for her big day at Knebworth Barns.  She said: 'I don't know who is to blame - is it the Government for taking over the hotel or is it Needham House Hotel for accepting it?  'But it isn't great to be told that you can't have your wedding there at such short notice when we've paid thousands of pounds and had much of the preparation work done.  'The Hotel have offered us a full refund - although they are not giving us any kind of compensation. They have also helped find another venue.  'It's been really tough but I'm of a more positive outlook now and in a better frame of mind.'  MailOnline has made multiple attempts to approach Needham House Hotel for comment.

Nine Muses member Minha (also known as Park Min Ha) revealed gorgeous wedding photos.  On May 18, the idol, who is now an actress, uploaded several photos of her and her newlywed husband on their wedding day.  Minha also posted a letter thanking those who attended and vowed to live happily ever after with her husband.  And so they lived happily ever after. On this fairytale-like day, although it is fitting to end it with, And so they lived happily ever after, we know that in reality it is (In spite of everything that occurred before them, eventually) They Lived Happily Ever After. No matter what day befalls us, we will not let go of each other and greet the coming seasons with a smile. I hoped everyone would be happy on this day, and just like my wish, this day was full of laughter. We, too, were happy without even an ounce of regret. I would like to thank everyone who attended the wedding and those who congratulated us from afar. I send my love to you. ‚Äî Minha  Minha also revealed that her fellow Nine Muses members, Euaerin, Kyungri, Hyunah, Hyemi, Keumjo, Sojin, and Songah, who promoted with her all attended her wedding.  Meanwhile, Nine Muses first debuted in 2010 and quickly gained a strong fandom due to their incredible visuals. Recently it was revealed that some of the group‚Äôs original members will be returning as a unit this summer, followed by a full-group comeback. Read more in the link below!

We‚Äôve made it to the end of Wediquette Week and our final question packs a punch. This week we‚Äôve talked about the cost of wedding gifts, plus ones and fashion. Read all four installments here. But today‚Äôs question is a two-parter that involves firing someone, essentially.  Question: A) Can I disinvite someone from a guest list? B) Also, related, can I fire a bridal party member?  Answer A: As a rule, disinviting a guest is one of the biggest ‚Äòdon‚Äôts‚Äô when it comes to weddings. This is why it‚Äôs so important to think long and hard about your guest list in the first place. If budget is a concern, create an A and a B list. Work from the A list first, then if spaces come available, begin adding from the B list. Meanwhile, life happens and people have fall outs. If that‚Äôs the case, it‚Äôs better to power through than to disinvite. There a few reasons for this: 1) No matter how upset the other party made you, disinviting them could create an unmendable rift. 2) Disinviting them could cause even more drama. 3) They might decide not to come without you disinviting them, so let the chips fall where they may, and it might work itself out. It could be beneficial to simply have a mature conversation (preferably in person or on the phone, but not via text or email unless it‚Äôs unavoidable, because you want the benefit of facial cues and body language) with the other party about what‚Äôs going on between the two of you. This could lead to mending the problem, a truce for the day of the wedding or, again, them deciding to sit this one out. If there are concerns over a person‚Äôs potential behavior at the wedding, this is also a good time to (maturely) address the situation.  Answer B: Any way you slice it, it can be tricky to fire an attendant. Also, there are a lot of reasons why you might want to and, since we don‚Äôt know the situation, here‚Äôs a general answer. It‚Äôs best to be direct and have a heart-to-heart. Again, this should happen in person or on the phone, but not via text or email unless it‚Äôs unavoidable, because you want the benefit of facial cues and body language. Approach he conversation with as much kindness and gentle grace as possible. A sample script is:  Get permission (this goes a long way): ‚ÄòCan we talk about the wedding?‚Äô  Indicate why you wanted them in your wedding in the first place: ‚ÄòI love you and you are one of my best friends, so naturally I want you to be a part of this wedding.‚Äô  Broach the problem: ‚ÄòBut, it seems as though [insert problem here using feeling statements].‚Äô (This could be anything from ‚Äòit seems as though life is really hectic and it‚Äôs hard to participate in a lot of the wedding activities,‚Äô to ‚ÄòI‚Äôve noticed tension between you and my sister‚Äô or whatever)  Say how this makes you feel: ‚ÄòI feel disappointed when I get an R.S.V.P. of yes and you‚Äôre absent, because I want to celebrate this time with you,‚Äô or ‚Äòit‚Äôs upsetting to me when I see you and my sister arguing.‚Äô Again, stick with whatever it is you feel when the problem occurs.  Give them an escape hatch: If you are having a hard time with [insert some aspect of the duties and commitments or clashing with the other attendants] I‚Äôm thinking it might ease the situation if you were to bow out of attendant duties.  Invite them to speak: ‚ÄòWhat do you think?‚Äô  Listen with an open heart and mind to what they have to say and be gentle, but direct with your responses. Be clear about your expectations. Give them an opportunity to respond. They may feel attacked, so let them vent and try not to get worked up in response. Most of all, be considerate and maybe also bring an offering of chocolate. Everything is better with chocolate.

Khajjiar  If you insist to now see beyond regular hill stations, look no further than Khajjiar, which is India‚Äôs answer to Switzerland. With a landscape like the European paradise, your big day celebrations will be an affair to remember.

May 20 has become the third Valentine's Day in China, as "5.20" sounds like "I love you" in Chinese.  Imaginechina  A group wedding for local young talent was held on the Huangpu River waterfront in Yangpu District on Friday to mark the so-called "Internet Valentine's Day" in China.  Eight couples, including university teachers, doctors and high-tech professionals working in the district, made vows under the witness of over 100 guests and received wedding certificates from government officials including Jiang Rui, head of the Shanghai Civil Affairs Bureau.  "I met my wife in Yangpu when I studied at the Naval Medical University, and she studied at the Tongji University," said one of the grooms surnamed Chen, who is a military doctor now.  "Yangpu witnessed our love story over the last six years, and we will jointly contribute to its future development," he said.  A famed calligrapher presented his artwork to the new couples and encouraged them to take responsibility for both their families and the society.  Imaginechina  It's part of Yangpu's effort to develop the waterfront, known as the birthplace of China's modern industries with the nation's first water, electricity, shipbuilding and textile companies, into a people-friendly urban space.  The ceremony also answers the call of President Xi Jinping to highlight the importance of family and traditions, according to the Yangpu District government.  May 20 has become the third Valentine's Day in China, apart from the Chinese Valentine's Day on qixi, or the lunar July 7, and the Western Valentine's Day on February 14, because "5.20" sounds like "I love you" in Chinese.  Another group wedding was held on the North Bund in Hongkou District ahead of May 20. Five couples, including construction workers, tech and finance elite, and community staff working on the North Bund, got married and shared their love stories related to the waterfront.

There was excitement in the air. The guests were dressed up in traditional ethnic wear. There were flowers and intricate rangoli. And a beautiful bride-to-be. Soon, the beating of drums at the gate signalled that the procession was on its way.  Welcome to the wedding of Bunty and Babli.  But then, the bride and bridegroom were not real. It was a unique wedding of dolls organised by Shreevatsa ‚Äî a childcare institute that provides shelter, family, education and medical aid to family-deprived and destitute children ‚Äî at the Sassoon general hospital.  ‚ÄúThis was a fantastic way of teaching these children the meaning of the institution of family. This was a way of imparting knowledge of our community to the children,‚Äù said Nirmala Lahoti, a committee member of the Society of Friends of Sassoon Hospitals (SOFOSH), which collaborated with Shreevatsa for the event.  ‚ÄúThese children do not have a family. There are certain events in our society that we are exposed to. We organise multiple activities throughout the year so that the children have an orientation of the events that take place in every household. We celebrate each and every festival,‚Äù said Sharmila Sayed, the administration head of Shreevatsa.  At the ‚Äúwedding‚Äù on Friday evening, Shreevatsa members danced with the children to vibrant beats and Marathi pop numbers. All the elements of a real wedding were in place: coloured rice was distributed followed by the recitation of the ‚Äúmangalashtak‚Äù and the varmala ceremony of the dolls named Bunty and Babli.  ‚ÄúA wedding ceremony is no less than a festival in an Indian household. Therefore, we ensured that we did our best to make this event as memorable as possible. We also invited children who were adopted. This is our way of showing them that they will always have a family here,‚Äù said Sayed.

Murder, mystery and romance have been in the air lately with a swathe of new Hallmark movie releases hitting the 2023 TV schedule . Though the channel is trying out some new titles like Curious Caterer, it‚Äôs also bringing back some major fan favorites. Among them is the latest installment in the Hannah Swensen Mysteries series (formerly Murder, She Baked). I was lucky enough to hear from Alison Sweeney about the latest installment Carrot Cake Murder. Ahead of the film‚Äôs release we talked weddings, ‚Äúprop‚Äù desserts, one reader-favorite cat and more.  As fans already know, Hannah (Sweeney) and her partner in crime solving Mike (Cameron Mathison) have been engaged for a while ‚Äì even during the course of events of the last franchise flick, Sweet Revenge. When I asked Ms. Sweeney about whether a wedding was imminent in her follow-up to the second Wedding Veil trilogy, she brought up what we know from Joanne Fluke‚Äôs books, but also joked about a body near a wedding cake.  Since Hannah hasn‚Äôt gotten married for real in the books, (except one time to a con artist that ended up being annulled lol), I can only imagine what her wedding would be like! I mean‚Ä¶ would she find a dead body underneath the cake?!  Speaking of cake, I‚Äôve always wondered how the cast manages to film all those dessert scenes without it impacting their waistlines, and Ms. Sweeney let us in on a bit of a secret: ‚Äúprop desserts.‚Äù Though there seems to be some eating involved, as the actress told CinemaBlend she often chooses which Joanne Fluke book she‚Äôd like to try next based on the recipes included in the books, keeping those sweets in check is part of the movie-making magic.  Yes - I often narrow down the books to consider what‚Äôs next based on the delicious titles. So many yummy recipes to choose from, and then lots of 'prop' desserts to avoid eating too much of [them]!  I guess one really can have their (carrot) cake and eat it too.  Sweeney and co. acquired the rights to the Fluke books ahead of the last film in the series, which led to the name change from Murder, She Baked to Hannah Swensen Mysteries. Despite some BTS complications related to the changes, the franchise is still going strong and Hallmark announced this week another one will be released in the coming months. The next film, A Zest for Death: A Hannah Swensen Mystery, will be based on the Joanne Fluke novel Lemon Meringue.  It's great news for the fans, as we have seen some murder mysteries canceled at Hallmark in recent months. There's so much more for the franchise to explore regarding Hannah's growth in mystery-solving as well as in her personal life, so I'm happy the movies were able to continue.  Sweeney previously told TV Insider the couple is ‚Äúnot very far into planning the wedding,‚Äù when the new movie picks up, so fans will likely be waiting for another Swensen sequel before they can get excited for a body at a wedding or -- let's be honest about what we're most excited about -- Hannah's choice of a dress. For now, she‚Äôs keeping mum on actual wedding plans, but she did say book fans should keep an eye out for ‚ÄúMoishe the cat‚Äù not being so happy about the engagement in the new film.  The plot's an Easter egg book fans can look forward to, though I'm still hoping we'll get more forward momentum this time around, and I'm not just talking about solving a mystery. Carrot Cake Murder premieres on Friday, May 19th at 9 p.m. ET, only on Hallmark.

A house-proud woman is refusing to let her relative attend a family wedding as she's concerned that their untrained dog - who will stay at her house - will ruin her new carpets  'My relative is missing a family wedding over my firm dog rule - I feel so guilty'  While you'd imagine that a wedding will be attended by your closest friends and family, one woman is putting her foot down about one relative's attendance.  The house-proud woman is refusing to allow her relative - who is staying at her home - to attend a family wedding as they'll be leaving their untrained dog alone.  Taking to popular forum site Reddit, the anonymous woman explained that she was fearful to leave the dog - who isn't house-trained - would ruin her new carpets if left unattended.  Seeking advice for the issue, the Reddit user questioned: "Would you allow a relative to stay if their dog wasn't house trained?"  Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto) Getty Images/iStockphoto)  She went on: "I had invited a relative to stay with us for a family wedding. He accepted but then told me his dog isn't housetrained.  "To be clear, we have dogs and are normally happy to have family bring their pets too but our dogs are all fully trained.  "All our carpets are new - less than a month old - and the house is open plan so it's impossible to contain his dog while he is here.  "I've said he can't bring the dog but it looks like that will mean he misses the wedding so I feel guilty," he added.  Since sharing her concerns, the woman's post has raked in over 120 comments to date - where people assured the Mumsnet user that she shouldn't feel 'guilty'.  Taking to the comment section, one person wrote: "I have three dogs - I absolutely love dogs - but no way would I want a dog who isn't house trained staying at my house. What a total nightmare that would be."  Meanwhile, someone else said: "Nope-I'm a dog owner and definitely not!!"  A third person penned: "I wouldn't allow the dog to come, housetrained or not. Your relative needs to make other arrangements or miss the wedding."  Maybe they could use the time to actually train the dog," they suggested.  Do you have a story? We want to hear it! Get in touch at grace.hoffman@reachplc.com

Kensington Palace may no longer be the Princess of Wales' primary residence, but she still has some sentimental decorations inside the palace walls ‚Äì including memories of her royal wedding.  Princess Kate got ready for King Charles' coronation inside the London property with her husband Prince William and their children Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis. A video of the preparations shared a new look inside the palace, where framed family photos decorate the grand interiors of apartment 1A.  WATCH: The Wales family film inside Kensington Palace on Coronation Day  Sitting atop a wooden side table with intricate wooden carvings was a photo of Kate's parents Carole and Michael Middleton on the day of their daughter's royal wedding in April 2011.  ¬© The Prince and Princess of Wales Kate has a framed photo of her parents at her wedding on display  Kate's mother looked elegant with her hands clasped in front of her as she wore a sky blue hat and matching Catherine Walker coat dress as she stood next to what appeared to be her husband.  ¬© CARL DE SOUZA Carole Middleton looked stunning in a blue coat dress at the royal wedding  Father of the bride Michael looked smart in a morning suit with a red tie, which he teamed with a top hat before removing it to walk his daughter down the aisle.  ¬© The Prince and Princess of Wales Prince Louis and Prince Charlotte joined their parents inside the property ahead of the coronation  The photo sat next to a large lamp near a window seat, while more family photos were on display on the other side of the room.  ¬© The Prince and Princess of Wales Prince Louis' birthday photo could be seen inside Kensington Palace  As Louis walked into the space, he was met with a picture of himself as a child, shared for his first birthday, as well as a snap of his elder sister Charlotte, then four, who wore a grey jumper in the garden of their Norfolk house, Anmer Hall.  When did Prince William and Princess Kate get married?  ¬© Getty The Prince and Princess of Wales got married in 2011  The Prince and Princess of Wales got married at Westminster Abbey on 29 April 2011. Kate arrived in the back of a Rolls Royce Phantom VI alongside her father, and she looked stunning in a Sarah Burton of Alexander McQueen lace gown.  It featured a V-neck, long sleeves and a corset bodice, as well as a nine-foot train that her maid of honour Pippa Middleton was pictured holding.  After they exchanged vows, Kate and William hosted a reception at Buckingham Palace, where Kate changed into a strapless gown with an embellished waist and a fur jacket.  What have Carole and Micheal Middleton said about Prince William and Princess Kate's relationship?  ¬© Getty Carole and Michael joined King Charles and Queen Camilla on the Buckingham Palace balcony at the royal wedding  Before proposing to his girlfriend in Kenya in 2010, William didn't ask Michael for his blessing. In a TV interview after their engagement was announced, he said to Tom Bradby: "Well, I was torn between asking Kate's dad first and then the realisation that he might actually say 'no' dawned upon me."  It didn't seem to matter since Michael later told reporters: "We all think he's wonderful and we're extremely fond of him."  ¬© Getty William has a close relationship with his in-laws  Meanwhile, Carole commented on her relationship with her two sons-in-law, Prince William and James Matthews. Chatting to the Telegraph, Carole described them as "lovely". She said: "I have two lovely sons-in-law and I hope I'll have a lovely daughter-in-law," referring to her youngest son James Middleton's wife Alizee Thevenet.  DISCOVER: Princess Kate makes surprising confession as she talks ‚Äòfalling in love‚Äô with Prince William  Planning your wedding?
